cards.notes:
Every delight, every sorrow, every wish and every regret. Remember them well, for they will die with you.

We pass on. Our memories, our sorrows, and our hopes fade with us. Yet life persists. A lotus blooms whether or not you are there to see it.

cards.rules_text:
Whenever you draw or conjure one or more cards, each player mills two cards.
Whenever you cast a blue spell, surveil 1. Then exile any number of cards from your hand and/or graveyard. If you exiled cards with three or more different card types this way, draw a card. Shuffle each card exiled this way onto the bottom of your library.

Choose an opponent. They look at the top four cards of your library and separate them into a face-down pile and a face-up pile. Put one pile into your hand and the other into your graveyard.

cards.flavor_text: [i]“In the summers of my youth, paper fish would swim in the wind in front of every shop, and jump over each roof with the breeze. Now I only see them in my dreams.”[/i]
